summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, commanding an individual named Astrid to appear before the grand jury on July 24, 2019, to testify and produce documents in an investigation into alleged violations of federal sex trafficking and conspiracy statutes. The document includes an advice of rights and a request to keep the subpoena confidential.

persons.name: Astrid
persons.context: Individual commanded to appear before the grand jury to testify and produce documents in connection with an investigation into alleged violations of federal sex trafficking and conspiracy laws.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.role: United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Issued the grand jury subpoena and signed the accompanying letter requesting confidentiality of the investigation.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance of Astrid
events.description: Astrid is commanded to appear before the federal grand jury at the U.S. Courthouse in Manhattan to testify and provide evidence.

events.title: Issuance of Grand Jury Subpoena
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office issues a subpoena to Astrid as part of an official criminal investigation into suspected felonies.

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Borough of Manhattan, City of New York, New York
The Silvio J. Motto Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The subpoena is part of an investigation into alleged violations of 18 U.S.C. §§ 1591 (sex trafficking), 2421 (transportation for prostitution), 2422 (coercion and enticement), 2423 (transportation of minors), and 371 (conspiracy).
The recipient, Astrid, is commanded to appear on July 24, 2019, at 10:00 a.m. and to bring unspecified items as demanded.
The U.S. Attorney's Office requests that the recipient voluntarily refrain from disclosing the existence of the subpoena to any third party to preserve the confidentiality of the investigation.
The document includes an 'Advice of Rights' informing the recipient of their right against self-incrimination and right to counsel.
